profileAlternative.name: Michael McLauchlan
profileAlternative.headline: Manager of Technical Training and Development at The Haskell Company
profileAlternative.summary:
After serving my country for 29 years in the US Navy Submarine Force, I came to the same realization that many who have served come to:

What next?

I found that my passion in the military translated to the private sector with Training and Development with a mix of Project Management. I enjoyed the development of a project designed to improve performance, but more importantly, I loved the connection I made with the associates at all levels of the company I worked for.

It was more than just the curriculum design, the scheduling or the execution, it was all about seeing a project through to the end and realizing the result and the impact it was having on employees workplace happiness and success.

I have found that with the Haskell Company. Great people and a growing, solid team of professionals. I look forward to growing with this company for years to come.

Experience:

- 30+ years of advanced curriculum design, development, and training delivery in operations, soft skills, and technical training to all levels of company management and operational associates.

- 20 years of Project Management design, development and implementation aligning with strategic goals and initiatives of each organization involved with. Certified Project Management Professional through PMI since 2014.

- 15+ years in Communications, Leadership, and Team Effectiveness training facilitation. Certified as an INSIGHTS Discovery Program practitioner since 2015.

- 5 years of manufacturing experience, delivering and coordinating training for the technical and support/corporate workforce with a 3-4 year strategic plan for world class maintenance level attainment.

- Certified MASTER TRAINING SPECIALISTS (MTS) since 1991, serving in an executive leadership position for 5+ plus years, the last 3 at a major Naval Training Center.

positions.title: Manager of Technical Training and Development
positions.description:
Responsible for the development and management of Technical Training for Field Supervisory employees, to include Construction Managers, Superintendents, Assistant Superintendents, Craft employees, and some Operational roles. Accomplishments Include:

- Established an new online, technical training program (asynchronous learning) with over 40 customized technical training courses, with field employees completing over 2500 hours of training (technical, operational, process, and compliance) in the first 12 months.

- Training program was the candidate for the Training Magazine 125 Outstanding New Initiative award for the company.

- New technical training program was a new part in Haskell's overall company training execution success, which resulted in Haskell being ranked #8 in the top 125 global rankings for 2018.

- Partnered with operations teams to develop process and system training for current and new systems that had a far reaching success. These systems included PROCORE, PIPS, and Pre-Vendor Qualification processes.

- Partnered with our Safety and Quality teams to produce an in-house, online, Safety Orientation for all of our field internal employees and sub-contracting partners. 55 day rollout produced over 5000 hours of completed training, with both English and Spanish versions available.
…
see more

positions.title: Technical Training Manager
positions.description:
Responsible for development and execution of technical (mechanical and electrical) and facilitation of Corporate soft skills training (to include INSIGHTS Discovery Training) for the 1000 plus workforce in Tennessee and Missouri at a medium-sized Health and Beauty Industrial Manufacturing Company.
Duties include:

- Curriculum development and review with program path implementation for all technical employees, designing curriculum for over 100 technical and nontechnical courses for the operator, mechanic, and supervisor workforce.

- Establishment of landmark "Craftsman Training Initiative" to establish and elevate foundational, competency-based training for an 110-person mechanical workforce to the World Class Maintenance level over a three-four year period. The program executed within 5 months of initial planning. Model for Workforce Development Board of Rutherford County.

- Executed over 40,000 associate-hours (5 years) of technical, non-technical, and soft skills training facilitation across two manufacturing plants to include skills and core competency attainment, equipment and machine adjustment and operation, processes, basic and advanced maintenance skills training, and soft skills training targeting individual and team-based training objectives.

-Developed and designed "Next Generation Workforce" training program, designed to elevate the foundational and core competency skill levels of operational production operators. Executed in 2016 and growth in 2017 to include SME development.

- Partnered with maintenance leadership to develop of operational procedures, documents, and training.
…
see more

positions.title: Facilities Maintenance Manager
positions.description:
Department Staff Leadership position. Responsible for the operational performance of 7 associates in the corrective and predictive maintenance of plant support and ancillary equipment throughout a medium sized manufacturing plant. Provided direct oversight and input into the planning and execution of a 4-line plant operation in support of overall plant operational success.

• Developed a tracking system for preventive maintenance of 70% of the plant equipment with review and updating of maintenance actions. This reduced backlog of maintenance actions by 92% over a one-month period.

• Designed a plan for fork-truck maintenance and operations, including a detailed checklist for all operators with a supervisor review and a tracking mechanism for fork-truck lifecycle management.

• Involved in the revolution of the factory storeroom operations to an automated program designed to improve efficiency and regain capital by returning unused and/or obsolete parts held.

…
see more

positions.title: US Navy
positions.description:
Command Executive Staff Position. Provided oversight to 160 military and civilian staff members in job training, curriculum, and instructional delivery, and certification throughput of 10,000 students annually. Coordinated creation and implementation of new and revised curriculum, streamlined several course timelines while saving the Navy significant funds. Planned and executed multiple projects’ progress and completion that improved efficiency and saved significant funds. Maintained professional advancement progression of 30-35 % for all staff assigned.

• Coordinated a building consolidation project plan for the staff, reducing footprint by 40 % utilizing and managing existing FY funding to include stakeholder management.

• Implemented rating advancement program which improved personnel advancement success by 15% in the first year.

• Provided executive training oversight in development of 80-85 personnel annually into senior leadership positions.

• Recognized as the best Command Master Chief as reported by local leadership in each evaluation reports: “has established a new standard in senior leadership in the Navy. A recognized expert in submarine leadership and operations, he continues to be the driving force for the success of the Kings Bay based submarines.”

• Earned top evaluations on all external inspections. TRIDENT Training Facility, Kings Bay, Georgia recognized as the top learning center in the submarine learning domain.

• Mentored all civilian employees to earn “Excellent” evaluations and the Naval Education and Training Support Detachment award.

…
see more

roles.title: Command Master Chief -TRIDENT Training Facility, Kings Bay GA
Chief of the Boat - USS Maryland SSBN 738 (GOLD)

roles.title: Command Master Chief -TRIDENT Training Facility, Kings Bay GA

positions.title:
Title
Chief of the Boat - USS Maryland SSBN 738 (GOLD)
positions.description:
Command Executive Staff position. Provided executive-level leadership in supervision to 170 enlisted and officer submarine crew members in the safe and successful completion of five 70-day at-sea underwater operations. Delivered detailed feedback counsel directly to the Commanding Officer on operational and crew personnel matters. Provided detailed oversight to senior enlisted and officer personnel in operational planning, implementation, and execution of at-sea underwater tactics.

• Coordinated the overhaul of training and operational programs across the command. Command recognized for operational and personnel excellence with two Battle Efficiency awards and the Omaha Trophy as the best strategic platform in the Navy. Personally, recognized by the Squadron with the Deckplate Leadership Award two times.

• Coordinated the development of senior enlisted leaders, maintained a 50% advancement rate with 4 of 6 being certified as the Senior Enlisted Leader (Chief of the Boat) position.

…
see more
